scenarioDescription:
The GJ 27.1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 27.1 is a star with 0.53 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 76.99 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 27.1 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 27.1 system


GJ 27.1 b

GJ 27.1 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2014-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 27.1 b is 13.006 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 27.1 b is 3.660 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 27.1 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 27.1, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: GJ 27.1 - System With 1 Exoplanet
